abstracts.cdata!:
With the approval and participation of
            community leaders, 1.45 million informal urban homesteaders
            in 13 cities across Peru were given title to the property on
            which they had settled. For millions of poor Peruvians who
            flocked to informal settlements on the outskirts of the
            country's cities, a World Bank-backed project to grant
            them formal title to their properties has given them hopes
            for a better future. With formal title, they have been able
            to take out loans to improve their houses and start businesses.
